FuncDef: The reset igmp-snooping qinq-group command deletes multicast entries on QinQ or dot1q termination sub-interfaces.
CLIs: reset igmp-snooping qinq-group { all | interface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } [ pe-vid <pe-vid> [ ce-vid <ce-vid> ] [ <group-address> [ mask { <group-mask> | <mask-length> } ] [ <source-address> [ mask { <source-mask> | <source-mask-length> } ] ] ] ] }

ParaDef.Info:
Deletes multicast entries on all QinQ or dot1q termination sub-interfaces.
-

Deletes multicast entries on a specified QinQ or dot1q termination sub-interface.
-

Specifies the type and number of an interface.
-

Specifies the ID of the VLAN to which a PE belongs.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies the ID of the VLAN to which a CE belongs.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies a multicast group address.
This value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask of a multicast group address.
This value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask length of a multicast group address.
The value is an integer ranging from 4 to 32.

Specifies a multicast source address.
This value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask of a multicast source address.
This value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask length of a multicast source address.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 32.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If multicast entries on all or a specified QinQ or dot1q termination sub-interface are unnecessary, run the reset igmp-snooping qinq-group command to delete the multicast entries.
